Tire as a solar collector: An upside-down tire filled with a reflective material can be used as a solar collector to absorb solar energy and heat water or serve as a parabolic dish for cooking.
Tire as a greenhouse: A tire filled with soil can be used to build a self-contained greenhouse to grow plants in areas with harsh weather conditions.
Tire as an emergency shelter: A tire can be used to create a lightweight, portable emergency shelter by connecting multiple tires together and adding a tarp or other covering.
Tire as a road construction tool: Tires filled with sand or gravel can be rolled over road construction sites to even out the surface and remove small debris.
Tire as a playground equipment: Tires can be cut into various shapes and sizes and used as slides, climbing structures, and other playground equipment for children.
